items.title: ­Why Laws Meant to Create Jobs Can Be So Destructive for Our Cities
items.abstract: How laws meant to inspire building things may incite destructive races to the bottom in places across the country.

items.title: A Sandwich Shop, a Tent City and an American Crisis
items.abstract: As homelessness overwhelms downtown Phoenix, a small business wonders how long it can hang on.

items.title: How A.I. Is Helping Architects Change Workplace Design
items.abstract: With more hybrid workers and new office needs, firms like Zaha Hadid Architects are turning to artificial intelligence for solutions.

items.title: Will a Dollar General Ruin a Rural Crossroads?
items.abstract: A fight over a proposed chain store is also about what “country” means to different people in a small community.

items.title: A Hiring Law Blazes a Path for A.I. Regulation
items.abstract: New York City’s pioneering, focused approach sets rules on how companies use the technology in work force decisions.
